availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Winford Green Bailey (Lincoln County, Kentucky, farmer, politician and county judge)

body.p: Lincoln County, Kentucky, farmer, politician and county judge. Lincoln County, Kentucky, native. Son of Elijah Bailey. Married to Catherine J. Embry Bailey in 1839. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky for Lincoln County in 1834 and 1835. Member of the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Lincoln County and Garrard County, Kentucky, from 1840 to 1844. Farmer in Lincoln County in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in 1850. Farmer in Lincoln County in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in 1860. Judge of the Lincoln County court in 1862.

ab.bibl:
